main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object near Atlanta, GA on April 18, 1958, reported by a Navy pilot. The object was described as round, with a very bright, bullet-shaped, fiery red tail, traveling at high speed in a northerly direction. Another report from a civilian observer corroborated the pilot's description.
interesting points: The object had a yellow haze or color, larger than a star but smaller than a full moon, and its flight path and duration differed from that usually associated with celestial events like meteors.
The Navy pilot believed the object to be under intelligent control and guidance.
The sighting took place between 23:15 and 23:20 Eastern Standard Time, and the object was out of sight in approximately 3 to 4 seconds.
The sighting was reported to the 20th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron, Dobbins Air Force Base, Marietta, GA, and to the control tower at Atlanta Municipal Airport.
The crash of a Navy jet fighter plane near Georgia, resulting in pilot blackout and ejection, was mentioned in the context of the UFO investigation.
sighted object: round unidentified flying object with a bright, fiery red tail
